intro: Pasania chittagonga, commonly known as the Chittagong pasania, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. It produces small, dark-colored fruits that are often consumed by various bird species. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
